div.p:
Path analyses results. Using among-individual correlation matrices to quantify the direct and indirect pathways by which exploratory behavior affected clutch size. Path coefficients (±SE) are printed alongside each hypothesized path (directional arrows) for the low-perceived predation level (PPL) (L: blue) and high-PPL (H: orange) treatment plots separately. Treatment-specific among-individual variances (
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$V_{\mathrm{I}}$$\end{document}
V

± SE), and cross-context correlations (
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$r_{{\mathrm{I}}_{{\mathrm{L}},{\mathrm{H}}}} \pm {\mathrm{SE}}$$\end{document}
r
I
L , H
± SE
), are printed for each trait. Source data are provided as a Source Data file, total sample size is 326 individuals (172 in low PPL, 154 in high PPL), and code is provided in Supplementary Data 1
